full_text:
Case 1:19-cr-00490-RMB Document 56 Filed 09/04/19 Page 2 of 2

Finally, it is unfortunate that your opinion piece may have been construed as an effort to chill Ms. Giuffre's and Mr. Boies' right to be heard under 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771 at the August 27, 2019 public hearing. You wrote: "[W]hatever informational interests the victims may have would be served by affording them a chance to attend the hearing, not by giving them a speaking role."

Sincerely,

RMB
Richard M. Berman
U.S.D.J.

cc: AUSA Maurene Comey; Martin G. Weinberg, Esq.;
Reid Weingarten, Esq.; David Boies, Esq.

2
DOJ-OGR-00000728

text_blocks.content: Finally, it is unfortunate that your opinion piece may have been construed as an effort to chill Ms. Giuffre's and Mr. Boies' right to be heard under 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771 at the August 27, 2019 public hearing. You wrote: "[W]hatever informational interests the victims may have would be served by affording them a chance to attend the hearing, not by giving them a speaking role."

cc: AUSA Maurene Comey; Martin G. Weinberg, Esq.;
Reid Weingarten, Esq.; David Boies, Esq.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a letter from a U.S. District Judge, Richard M. Berman, regarding a public hearing and the rights of victims under 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771. The document is well-formatted and legible, with a handwritten signature.
